sen.j: 即位の礼（そくいのれい）は、天皇が践祚（せんそ）の後、皇位を継承したことを公示する儀式。
sen.e: Sokui no rei is a ceremony that notifies publicly that the Emperor succeeded the Imperial Throne after the accession.

sen.e: It is considered the highest ceremony of the Imperial Family.

sen.j: 諸外国における戴冠式にあたる。

sen.j: 皇太子が新たに皇位につくことを即位という。

sen.j: 古代では神へ寿詞を奏上し八尺瓊勾玉を献納する事を中心とした簡素なものであった。
sen.e: In ancient times, it was simple, focusing on congratulating the Emperor for his long and prosperous reign and offering Yasakani-no-Magatama to the god.

sen.j: 平安時代に皇位の継承である践祚と即位が別の儀式として行われるようになった。

sen.j: 即位にかかる儀式全般を即位儀礼という。

sen.j: これは皇太子が即位する「践祚の儀」と即位したことを内外に宣下する「即位の礼」に分かれる。
sen.e: They are divided into the "Senso-no-gi," in which the Crown Prince accedes to the throne and "Sokui no rei," in which imperial proclamation is carried out in and around.

sen.e: Since the law was abolished after the war, there are no specific regulations about the contents although the Imperial House Act regulates to hold the Sokui no rei.

sen.j: また、即位の礼の後に五穀豊穣を感謝し、その継続を祈る一代一度の大嘗祭が行われる。
sen.e: Moreover, after the Sokui no rei, once-in-a-lifetime Daijosai (first ceremonial offering of rice by newly-enthroned Emperor) is held to appreciate abundant crop and prays for a continuous good harvest.

sen.j: 即位の礼・大嘗祭と一連の儀式を合わせ大礼（たいれい）または大典（たいてん）という。
sen.e: Sokui no rei, Daijosai and a series of ceremonies are together called a Tairei or Taiten.

sen.j: 明治時代以降、他の皇室慶弔行事と同じように、即位の礼の日はその年限りの国民の祝日となることが慣例となっている。
sen.e: After the Meiji period, it became custom that the day of the Sokui no rei becomes a national holiday only for that year like other Imperial-Family congratulations-and-condolences events.

sen.j: その際、大正天皇と昭和天皇の即位の礼のときは勅令によって、今上天皇の即位の礼のときは法律によって、祝日として定められた。
sen.e: The days of Emperor Taisho's and Emperor Showa's Sokui no rei were set as national holidays by the Imperial edicts, and the day of the present Emperor's Sokui no rei of was set as a national holiday by the law.

sen.j: 中世以後（初例は後三条天皇とされているが、恒例となったのは後深草天皇以後とされる）には即位灌頂と呼ばれる仏教様式の儀式も執り行われた。
sen.e: In and after medieval times, Buddhist style ceremonies called Sokui Kanjo (Buddhist ritual of accession ordination) were also held (although it is said that the first case was made at Emperor Gosanjo, it become an established custom after Emperor Gofukakusa).

sen.j: 明治維新により天皇が国家の最高指導者に位置付けられてからは皇室典範並びに登極令の制定により天皇の践祚・即位に関わる一連の儀式の様式が定められた。
sen.e: Since the Emperor was regard as the national supreme leader by the Meiji Restoration, the form of a series of ceremonies in regard of the accession and enthronement of the Emperor was defined by the newly established Imperial House Act and Tokyoku-rei.

sen.e: The ceremony starts with announcing the date to Amaterasu Omikami (the Sun Goddess), Imperial Family's soshin (ancestor honored as god) and successive Emperors.

sen.j: 即位の礼では最重要の儀式が「正殿の儀」であり、天皇は束帯、皇后は十二単に身を包む。
sen.e: In Sokui no rei, "Enthronement Ceremony" is the most important ceremony where the Emperor wears sokutai (traditional ceremonial court dress); and the Empress wears juni-hitoe (twelve-layered ceremonial kimono).

sen.j: 慶応2年12月25日 (旧暦)（1867年1月30日）、孝明天皇の崩御を受け、儲君睦仁親王が翌慶応3年1月9日 (旧暦)（1867年2月13日）に践祚して皇位を継承した。
sen.e: After the death of the Emperor Komei on December 25, Keio 2 (old lunar calendar) (January 30, 1867), Imperial Prince Mutsuhito ascended and succeeded Imperial Throne in the following year, on January 9, Keio 3 (old lunar calendar) (February 13, 1867).

sen.j: 当初は11月に即位の礼を行う予定であったが、大政奉還など時勢が急速に変化していく中で国事多難を理由に見送られた。
sen.e: Although the Sokui no rei was originally going to be held in November, it was postponed because of the troubled national situation in the transitions of time, such as Restoration of the Imperial rule.

sen.j: 明治新政府は翌年の慶応4年（明治元年/1868年）5月 (旧暦)に新時代の到来を宣布する為、変化に相応しい新しい即位式の挙行を目指した。
sen.e: The new Meiji Government aimed at new enthronement ceremony, which might be appropriate for the changes, in order to declare the arrival of a new era in May Keio 4 (the first year of the Meiji period/ 1868).

sen.j: そのため津和野藩主で神祇官副知事の亀井茲監をして「御即位新式取調御用掛」に任命した。
sen.e: For that purpose, Koremi KAMEI, who was the lord of Tsuwano Domain and the vice-governor of Jingikan (Department of Divinities), was appointed to the "new-style enthronement investigation Goyogakari (official of the Imperial Household)."

sen.j: 様式は平安時代に改め、新時代の象徴として式典に於いて地球儀を用い皇威を世界に知らしめる事を目的とした。
sen.e: The style was changed to the style of the Heian period, and at the ceremony, a terrestrial globe was used as a symbol of the new era in order to show majesty of the Emperor to the world.

sen.e: On November 6, 1928 (Showa 3), Emperor Showa left Miyagi and went to Kyoto Imperial Palace to hold the Sokui no rei.

sen.j: 京都へ向かう天皇の行列は2名の陸軍大尉を先頭に賢所の神鏡を奉安した御羽車、昭和天皇の乗る6頭立て馬車・香淳皇后の乗る4頭立て馬車・皇族代表・内大臣（牧野伸顕）・内閣総理大臣（田中義一）の馬車と続いた。
sen.e: The parade of the Emperor heading to Kyoto consisted of two army captains at the head, following a palanquin where the divine mirror of Kashikodokoro (Imperial Sanctuary) enshrined, a coach-and-six where Emperor Showa rode, a coach-and-four where Empress Kojun rode, a coach of the Naidaijin (minister of the center) (Nobuaki MAKINO), a representative of royal family, and the Prime Minister (Giichi TANAKA).

sen.j: なお、現在の阪急京都本線の前身である新京阪鉄道と、近鉄京都線の前身である奈良電気鉄道は、この昭和天皇即位大典に間に合わせるようにして、それぞれ暫定開業をしている。
sen.e: Moreover, Shinkeihan Railway, the former Hankyu Kyoto Line, and Nara Electric Railway, the former Kintetsu Kyoto Line, provisionally opened in time for the enthronement of the Emperor Showa.

tit.j: 今上天皇の即位の礼・大嘗祭
tit.e: Sokui no rei and Daijo-sai festival of the present Emperor

Sokui no rei and Daijo-sai festival of the present Emperor

sen.j: 明仁の即位の礼・大嘗祭を巡る儀式は平成2年（1990年）1月23日の期日奉告の儀から始まり、1年間に渉り関連行事が行われた。
sen.e: The ceremonies that concerned Akihito's Sokui no rei and Daijo-sai festival started with the ceremony of announcing the dates on January 23, 1990 (Heisei 2), and the related events were held for one year.

The ceremonies that concerned Akihito's Sokui no rei and Daijo-sai festival started with the ceremony of announcing the dates on January 23, 1990 (Heisei 2), and the related events were held for one year.

sen.j: 即位の礼にあたり、式典の警備・要人警護には昭和天皇の大喪の礼での3万2000人を大きく上回る3万7000人の皇宮護衛官、警察官が動員された。
sen.e: At the Sokui no rei, 37,000 Imperial guards and police officers, were mobilized to guard the ceremonies and protect VIPs, more than at the time of Imperial funeral ceremony of Emperor Showa where 32,000 were mobilized.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: At the Sokui no rei, 37,000 Imperial guards and police officers, were mobilized to guard the ceremonies and protect VIPs, more than at the time of Imperial funeral ceremony of Emperor Showa where 32,000 were mobilized.

sen.j: 徹底した検問などが行われた。
sen.e: They held the thorough inspections etc.

sen.e: They held the thorough inspections and so on.

sen.j: この警備の特別予算は54億円に上ったとされる。
sen.e: It is said that the special budget for the security reached 5,400 million yen.
It is said that the special budget for the security reached 5,400 million yen.

sen.j: 即位を祝う饗宴の儀は宮殿豊明殿で11月12日から行われ、15日迄計7回、延べ3,500人の賓客が招かれた。
sen.e: From November 12th to 15th, banquets celebrating the enthronement were taken seven times at Homeiden State Banquet Hallin in the palace, and a total of 3,500 honored guests were invited.

sen.j: NHKが中継した「即位の礼・正殿の儀」（12時20分から1時間40分放送）は、平均視聴率31.9%（ビデオリサーチ・関東地区調べ）を記録した。
sen.e: "The Sokui no rei and the Enthronement Ceremony" (1 hour and 40 minute air time from 12:20), which broadcasted on NHK, had an average audience rating of 31.9 percent (in Kanto region according to Video Research).

tit.j: 即位礼正殿の儀おことば
tit.e: The Imperial message at the Enthronement Ceremony
The Imperial message at the Enthronement Ceremony
The Imperial message at the Enthronement Ceremony

sen.j: さきに、日本国憲法及び皇室典範の定めるところによって皇位を継承しましたが、ここに即位礼正殿の儀を行い、即位を内外に宣明いたします。
sen.e: Imperial Throne was succeeded in advance under the provision of the Constitution of Japan and the Imperial House Act, and here, I hold the Enthronement Ceremony and announce the enthronement in and around.

Imperial Throne was succeeded in advance under the provision of the Constitution of Japan and the Imperial House Act, and here, I hold the Enthronement Ceremony and announce the enthronement in and around.

Imperial Throne was succeeded in advance under the provision of the Constitution of Japan and the Imperial House Act, and here, I hold the Enthronement Ceremony and announce the enthronement in and around.

sen.j: このときに当り、改めて、御父昭和天皇の六十余年にわたる御在位の間、いかなるときも、国民と苦楽を共にされた御心を心とします。
sen.e: At this moment, I am reminded of the will of my father Emperor Showa who always shared joys and sorrows with Japanese people during little more than 60 year of his reign.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: At this moment, I am reminded of the will of my father Emperor Showa who always shared joys and sorrows with Japanese people during little more than 60 year of his reign.
At this moment, I am reminded of the will of my father Emperor Showa who always shared joys and sorrows with Japanese people during little more than 60 year of his reign.

sen.j: 常に国民の幸福を願いつつ、日本国憲法を遵守し、日本国及び日本国民統合の象徴としてのつとめを果たすことを誓います。
sen.e: I swear to accomplish the duties as a symbol of Japan and the unity of the Japanese people as I always wish people's happiness and follow the Constitution of Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: I swear to accomplish the duties as a symbol of Japan and the unity of the Japanese people as I always wish people's happiness and follow the Constitution of Japan.
I swear to accomplish the duties as a symbol of Japan and the unity of the Japanese people as I always wish people's happiness and follow the Constitution of Japan.

sen.j: 国民の叡智とたゆみない努力によって、我が国が一層の発展を遂げ、国際社会の友好と平和、人類の福祉と繁栄に寄与することを切に希望いたします。
sen.e: I eagerly hope that our country accomplishes further development and contributes to the friendship and peace of the international society and the welfare and prosperity of human beings by our people's wisdom and persistent efforts.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。

sen.j: 明治天皇・大正天皇・昭和天皇と近代に入ってからも京都御所に於いて即位の礼が行われ続けていた。
sen.e: Even after the modern ages, Sokui no rei had been continuously taken place at Kyoto Imperial Palace, and so were Emperor Meiji's, Emperor Taisho's and Emperor Showa's.
